text: Chile was first at the Olympic Games at the first 1896 Summer Olympics. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Chile is CHI. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-8-16. ==History== A team from Chile has been in most Summer Olympic Games and Winter Olympic Games. Chilean athletes have won a total of thirteen medals, with tennis as the top medal-producing sport. The National Olympic Committee for Chile was formed in 1934. ==Medalists== Medal Name Games Sport Event 1928 Amsterdam Athletics Men's marathon 1952 Helsinki Equestrian Individual jumping Ricardo Echeverría César Mendoza 1952 Helsinki Equestrian Team jumping 1956 Melbourne Athletics Women's javelin throw 1956 Melbourne Boxing Men's bantamweight 1956 Melbourne Boxing Men's middleweight 1956 Melbourne Boxing Men's light heavyweight 1988 Seoul Shooting Mixed skeet National football team 2000 Sydney Football Men's competition Nicolás Massú 2004 Athens Tennis Men's doubles 2004 Athens Tennis Men's singles 2004 Athens Tennis Men's singles 2008 Beijing Tennis Men's singles ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes == References == ==Other websites == * Chile profile at London2012.com * Chile at Olympic.org Olympics Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:National sports teams of Chile
title: Chile at the Olympics
